perturbation.original_text: 10.1   (b)     Each Party shall notify the other at least thirty (30) days or                in any event as soon as possible, before any change is made in                its licences or operating authorities which may affect in any                way the performance of any of its obligations under this                Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1   (b)     Each Party may notify the other ten (10) days after any change is made in its licences or operating authorities which may affect in any way the performance of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'at least thirty (30) days or as soon as possible' to 'ten (10) days after any change' creates a contradiction. Reducing the notice period and shifting it to *after* the change violates regulations requiring advance notice for significant operational changes that could affect service quality or safety. It is an unreasonably short time frame to have the other party prepare for a possible action.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Violates general requirements for maintaining adequate operating authority and providing timely notice of changes that could impact regulatory compliance or contractual performance; violates general principles of foreseeability.
